title: Citi Handlowy at the Fourth Polish Women's Congress
summary: Warsaw, Poland - Citi Handlowy attended the fourth edition of the Polish Women's Congress on September 14- 15 in Warsaw's Palace of Culture and Science. The Polish Women's Congress was formed in 2009 as a platform to exchange ideas and opinions on the role and involvement of women in the social and economic transformation of Poland.
tag-1: Citi Handlowy at the Fourth Polish Women's Congress
tag-2: Warsaw, Poland – Citi Handlowy attended the fourth edition of the Polish Women's Congress on September 14- 15 in Warsaw's Palace of Culture and Science. The Polish Women's Congress was formed in 2009 as a platform to exchange ideas and opinions on the role and involvement of women in the social and economic transformation of Poland.
tag-3: A strategic partner of the event, Citi Handlowy was represented by female management including Katarzyna Józefowicz, Head of Consumer Retail Banking Division, and Agnieszka Dydycz, Head of Strategic Projects at Citi Handlowy and Management Board Member of Kronenberg Foundation.
tag-4: "The Polish Women's Congress was a great opportunity to stop for a second and think about women's and men's role in today's world – both in politics and business. Ernst & Young experts highlight that the number of women working for Fortune's top-500 companies doubled over the last 10 years, and forecasts that by 2028, women will decide about 75 percent of the consumption spending globally", said Katarzyna Józefowicz during the event. "It is worth mentioning Citi Handlowy's achievement in this matter – women comprise a large number of our employees here, and in particular, managers. With this in mind, the bank organized a special Citi Women initiative which provides special training and mentoring as well as lectures on health to women."
tag-5: The event was designed to show entrepreneurial best practices and to inspire innovative ideas. This year's Polish Women's Congress focused on entrepreneurship and independence of women and was widely commented on by the Polish media. Witrtualna Polska, one of Poland's most influential web portals, quoted Katarzyna Józefowicz saying, "Success is an individual matter. It's like happiness: hard to define, but you know when you've achieved it".
tag-6: The Congress was attended by thousands of women in Poland across business, politics, science and the arts sectors.
